New Records: Jordan Walker had the first five-hit game by a Cardinal since Matt Carpenter in 2018.
The Cardinals set season highs for runs and hits (21).
Key Match Events: Jordan Walker went 5-for-5, including a long two-run homer in the fifth and a two-run homer in the ninth.
Lars Nootbaar hit a bases-clearing two-strike double in the seventh and added a two-run homer in the ninth.
Victor Scott II hit an RBI double and scored on a throwing error by reliever Phil Bickford.
Anthony Rizzo hit an RBI double to start a three-run fifth.
Alex Verdugo and Gleyber Torres hit run-scoring singles.
Anthony Volpe hit an RBI single and Torres lifted a tying sacrifice fly in the sixth.
Rookie Masyn Wynn hit a two-run double and Luken Baker hit a two-run homer in a four-run fourth off Nestor Cortes.
Giancarlo Stanton homered and Jazz Chisholm Jr. scored on an error in the second.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees gave up their most hits since allowing 24 to Cleveland on Aug. 15, 2019.
The Cardinals were 0-7 in the regular season at Yankee Stadium before winning the final two games of the series.
Others: Cardinals: LHP Steven Matz was activated after completing his rehab from a back injury and could start later this week.
OF Michael Siani was activated after missing nearly a month with a strained right oblique and will join the team Monday in Milwaukee.
Yankees: RHP Luis Gil (lower back strain) threw 80 pitches in 3 2/3 innings in a rehab game for Double-A Somerset.
RHP Clarke Schmidt (strained right lat) will pitch in Somerset’s makeup game at Binghamton on Monday.
Both pitchers could return to the rotation next weekend against the Cubs in Chicago.
RHP Ian Hamilton (strained right lat) threw a bullpen session Sunday and will make a rehab appearance for Somerset Wednesday.
Cardinals: RHP Andre Pallante (6-6, 3.80 ERA) opposes RHP Freddy Peralta (9-8, 3.70) in the opener of a three-game series Monday in Milwaukee.
Yankees: RHP Gerrit Cole (5-3, 3.86) opens a three-game series in Texas Monday.
